summary: This document is an email chain from July 2019 between FBI personnel and Assistant U.S. Attorneys regarding the scanning and processing of 22 boxes of case records from two FBI case files (72-MM-113327 and 31E-MM-108062) related to the Epstein investigation. It details the discovery of missing documents, the non-scanning of pornographic images of young girls, and logistical coordination for returning the materials.

persons.name: Rossmiller
persons.context: Identified as an Assistant U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York, one of the prosecutors working on the investigation, and the sender of the initial email providing contact information and case file details.

events.title: Completion of Case Record Scanning
events.description: The FBI's digital team finishes scanning 22 boxes of case records, discovers three missing 1A documents and two missing serials, and notes the presence of unscanned pornographic images of young girls.

events.title: Prior Scanning by Miami Field Office
events.description: It is discovered that the Miami Field Office had requested scanning of some of the case record boxes back in 2013.

events.title: Shipment of Case Record Boxes
events.description: 22 boxes of case records are shipped from New York to the FBI's IMD division via FedEx, with tracking provided.

keyFacts: The document references two specific FBI case files being processed: 72-MM-113327 and 31E-MM-108062.
During scanning, pornographic images of young girls were found in the files and were not scanned per FBI protocols; a 'possible child pornography DO NOT SCAN' notation was placed.
Three 1A documents (1A10, 1A28, 1A84) and two serials from file 31E-MM-108062 were discovered missing from the physical files but were retrieved digitally from the network.

The email chain involves coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York and the FBI's IMD division to ensure complete scanning for discovery purposes in an ongoing investigation.
Most personal names and email addresses in the correspondence are redacted, indicated by angle brackets or placeholders like (USANYS) and (NY) (FBI).
